title: How did the telephone invention became so useful for humans? - Quora

response.answer_text: What changed our life is not telephone itself, but communication style. Before telephone was invented, we had to use telegram or letters to contact our friends. Telegram is not convenient and letters takes too much time. The most important advantage of telephone is that it made instant message possible. You can talk with your friends like face to face via telephone. You can ask and answer question instantly, which is impossible with telegram or letters. In brief, telephone made distant “talk” possible. You can really “talk” with somebody, even there’s a long distance between you.

I've answered a very similar question before, and the answer is simple - instantaneous communication over long distances, this then led, almost directly, to other communication forms, such as computer networks, and the internet. It had turned us into a global village as opposed to a globe of villages...
